newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore shares seen range-bound, exports cap.
newsitem.headline: Singapore shares seen range-bound, exports cap.

text.p: Singapore shares were seen range-bound on Monday, with Friday's disappointing non-oil May export data likely to cap any upside, dealers said.
They said the continual flow of funds away from Singapore into the Hong Kong exchange and Thailand's financial woes were expected to weigh on sentiment here.
The Straits Times Industrials Index ended up 5.47 points at 2,008.44 on Friday after Singapore reported nominal exports year-on-year fell one percent.
A Reuter survey earlier showed consensus of a 3.5 percent rise.
